definition: Six Methods of forming Chinese characters, according to Han dictionary Shuowen 說文|说文 - namely, two primary methods: 象形 (pictogram), 指事 (ideogram), two compound methods: 會意|会意 (combined ideogram), 形聲|形声 (ideogram plus phonetic), and two transfer methods: 假借 (loan), 轉注|转注 (transfer)
six/6
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write

sentences.english: Introduce character-making principles and six categories of Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 依漢字結構，介紹造字原理與六書內涵。

sentences.english: Transcription is one of the six categories of traditional structural theory of Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 轉註是傳統漢字結構理論的“六書”之一。

sentences.english: In ancient China, Chinese characters were made according to six categories.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代透過六書的方法造字。

sentences.english: Six books, most recently Invention of Air.
Fourth, explaining the principle about Liushu and shuowen.
sentences.chinese: 第四，系統地闡發六書與《說文》的條例。

sentences.english: There will be a briefing book six but very creative and dynamic websites.
sentences.chinese: 是一個能有介紹六書但卻很有創造力及活力的網站。

definition: ideogram plus phonetic (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/also known as phonogram, phonetic compound or picto-phonetic character
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
transfer character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character with meanings influenced by other words/sometimes called mutually explanatory character
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
phonetic component of a Chinese character
philology
almanac
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
subtle words with profound meaning (idiom)
meaning of a character
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
the Rites of Zhou (in Confucianism)
History of Zhou of the Northern Dynasties, twelfth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Linghu Defen 令狐德棻[Ling2 hu2 De2 fen1] in 636 during Tang Dynasty, 50 scrolls
Xu Shen (-147) the compiler of the original Han dynasty dictionary Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
Classic of Rites (same as 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4])
dictionary/encyclopedia
